provarHome.description: Contains the location that the Provar installation was unzipped. ​This attribute is not required if there is a full Provar installation in the default location, or if PROVAR_HOME Environment Variable is set

projectPath.description: The fully qualified path of the Test Project containing the tests to be run.  This is the folder that contains the .testproject file

resultsPath.description: The fully qualified path of the folder to which Provar will write the test results

outputLevel.description: Controls the amount of test output logged to the ANT test log.

excludeCallable.description: Indicates whether Callable Test Cases should be omitted from execution (true) or included in execution (false)

connectionRefreshType.description: Controls the Metadata at Connection level

lightningMode.description: Indicates org is lightning or not

stopOnError.description: Indicates whether the Test Run should abort automatically if any test failure is encountered

cachePath.description: The fully qualified path of the folder that will be used for storing the metadata cache

testEnvironment.description: The name of the Test Environment that the test run should be executed against. Test Environments are defined in Test Settings

webBrowser.description: The web browser to be used for UI testing

webBrowserConfig.description: The web browser window size. Browser configurations are defined in Test Settings

email.description: One or more email recipients defining settings for sending email upon test execution completion

sendEmail.description: Indicates whether an email should be sent after test run execution

toRecipients.description: The primary email addresses which should receive the email

ccRecipients.description: he email addresses which should be CC’d in the email

bccRecipients.description: The email addresses which should be BCC’d in the email

testPlan.description: List of test plan names to be executed, wildcards are permitted

testCase.description: One or more fileset elements defining the .testcase files to be run.  You can specify individual Test Case files, folders containing Test Case files or a combination of both

connectionOverride.description: name:value pairs where the first entry is the provar Connection name and the second is a SFDX username/user-alias to substitute
